Package game.actors

Class EnemyActor

java.lang.Object
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.GameEntity
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
game.actors.EnemyActor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Printable, Attackable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Abxervyer, EldentreeGuardian, ForestKeeper, HollowSoldier, LivingBranch, RedWolf, WanderingUndead
public abstract class EnemyActor
extends Actor
implements Attackable
Class representing an enemy actor in the game. The EnemyActor class extends the Actor class and represents an enemy character in the game. It includes behaviors such as wandering and attacking.

    • unconscious

      public java.lang.String unconscious​(Actor actor, GameMap map)
      Overrides the unconscious method to handle additional actions upon an enemy actor becoming unconscious. This includes dropping items and runes.
      Overrides:
      unconscious in class Actor
      Parameters:
      actor - the actor performing the action
      map - the game map where the action is executed
      Returns:
      the outcome of the unconscious action

    • dropRune

      public void dropRune​(Actor actor, GameMap map)

      Parameters:
      actor - the actor representing the enemy
      map - the game map where the action is executed

    • dropItems

      Parameters:

      map - The map where the actor fell unconscious.

    • playTurn

      public Action playTurn​(ActionList actions, Action lastAction, GameMap map, Display display)
      Determines the action to be performed during the enemy actor's turn.
      Specified by:
      playTurn in class Actor
      Parameters:
      actions - Collection of possible Actions for this actor.
      lastAction - The Action this actor took last turn.
      map - The map containing the actor.
      display - The I/O object to which messages may be written.
      Returns:
      The valid action that can be performed in that iteration or null if no valid action is found.

    • allowableActions

      public ActionList allowableActions​(Actor otherActor, java.lang.String direction, GameMap map)
      Determines the allowable actions when the enemy actor is attacked by another actor.
      Specified by:
      allowableActions in interface Attackable
      Overrides:
      allowableActions in class Actor
      Parameters:
      otherActor - The actor that might be performing an attack.
      direction - String representing the direction of the other actor.
      map - Current GameMap.
      Returns:
      A list of allowable actions for the enemy actor.
